def_cn: （通常因难以看清而）盯着看，凝视，端详
def_en: If you peer at something, you look at it very hard, usually because it is difficult to see clearly.

def_cn: （英国有权或曾经有权在上议院投票的）贵族
def_en: In Britain, a peer is a member of the nobility who has or had the right to vote in the House of Lords.

def_cn: 同龄人；同辈；身份（或地位）相同的人
def_en: Your peers are the people who are the same age as you or who have the same status as you.
